alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 5:29PM PDT until August 20 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Tulare. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 528 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.2 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springville and Uhl. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
